ud7.1:1.2: At one time the Buddha was staying near Sāvatthī in Jeta’s Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s monastery.
ud7.1:1.3: Now at that time Venerable Sāriputta was educating, encouraging, firing up, and inspiring Venerable Bhaddiya the Dwarf with a Dhamma talk.
ud7.1:2.1: Then after being taught like this Bhaddiya’s mind was freed from defilements by not grasping.
ud7.1:3.1: The Buddha saw what had happened.
ud7.1:4.1: Then, knowing the meaning of this, on that occasion the Buddha expressed this heartfelt sentiment:
ud7.1:5.3: Freed like this, he has crossed the flood
ud7.1:5.4: not crossed before, so as to not be reborn.”
